newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico leader visits Nobel laureate Paz in hospital.
newsitem.headline: Mexico leader visits Nobel laureate Paz in hospital.

text.p: President Ernesto Zedillo on Friday visited ailing Nobel poet laureate Octavio Paz, who entered a hospital five days ago for what was at first described as a checkup, state news agency Notimex said.
Notimex said Zedillo spoke briefly with Paz, 82, but it gave no further information. A hospital worker confirmed the visit but declined to give further details.
On Thursday Paz's magazine, Vuelta, issued a statement that said he was undergoing some clinical tests but was healthy and expected to return to his normal activities shortly.

When Notimex initially reported Paz's admission into a hospital on Monday, it said he was depressed following a fire at his home in December which destroyed a precious collection of his books and artefacts. The fire was caused by a short circuit in a television set.

Paz, who won the Nobel prize for literature in 1990, is considered one of Mexico's finest poets. He also wrote "The Labyrinth of Solitude", his best-known and most controverisal work that takes a critical look at the Mexican personality.
He suffers from phlebitis, which causes blood circulation problems and restricts his mobility.
